def pivot_table(
    data,
    values=None,
    index=None,
    columns=None,
    aggfunc="mean",
    fill_value=None,
    margins=False,
    dropna=True,
    margins_name="All",
    observed=False,
) -> "DataFrame":
    # existing implementation of pivot_table

    # Corrected code for multi-index columns handling
    if columns is not None and isinstance(columns, (list, tuple)):
        if len(columns) > 1:
            # Handling multi-index columns
            table = data.pivot_table(values=values, index=index, fill_value=fill_value, aggfunc=aggfunc)
            new_columns = pd.MultiIndex.from_product(columns)
            table.columns = new_columns
            return table
        else:
            # Standard pivot_table behavior for single column index
            return data.pivot_table(values=values, index=index, columns=columns, fill_value=fill_value, aggfunc=aggfunc)
    else:
        # Standard pivot_table behavior for non-multi-index columns
        return data.pivot_table(values=values, index=index, columns=columns, fill_value=fill_value, aggfunc=aggfunc)
